title: Utilitarianism
content:
Utilitarianism
[功利主义]
Last Saturday, I attended a talk on SEO.
[上周六我参加了一个关于 SEO 的分享会。]
The very next day, I rushed to take action—buying a domain, developing, and launching.
[第二天我就急匆匆地开始实践，申请域名、开发、上线。]
It took me a couple of days to realize that I had gone against my own principle of long-term thinking—wasn’t this just opportunistic behavior?
[过了两天我才反应过来自己违背了长期主义的原则，这样匆忙的行为不就是一种投机吗？]
Nothing is ever as easy as it seems. Taking action is good, but doing it with a utilitarian, shortcut-seeking mindset is a mistake.
[任何事情都没有想象中那么简单，实践本身是好事，但怀着功利主义、想速成的心态就是错误的。]
So what now?
[那接下来该怎么办呢？]
I need to slow down, be strategic, and focus on consistent output to drive my growth. First learn, then act—with the right mindset.
[我应该静下心来，有技巧地、有输出地推进自己的成长计划，先学习，再实践，摆正心态。]
